intro: Euodia sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. The leaves are often used in perfumery due to their strong, distinctive scent.
